lyrics.stanza: The living of Christ when He sojourned on earth, The sixteenth Psalm shows us, was wholly of worth. His attitudes, choices, and interests all tell The man who in God's tabernacle may dwell.
"As for all the saints who are dwelling on earth," To Him they're the people of excellent worth. Of them He has said He has all His delight— In proving this all the four Gospels unite.
His heart thus was glad and His spirit rejoiced, And e'en in His death praise to God could be voiced; His soul God would never abandon to hell, But in resurrection His body would dwell.
God raised Him, and He with God's glory was crowned; Then fulness of joy in God's presence He found. E'en now at the Father's right hand is His seat, Where flowing forever are pleasures complete.
